title: MyMachine
segmentation: Hello everybody this.
Looks very much like a Friday afternoon on the last day of the conference.
I'm familiar with the with the setting so, but thank you very much for inviting us an it's a pleasure to present my machine, but.
Before I start, I think I have to apologize a little bit.
About the topic of the conference is open education and I have to.
Confess that I know nothing about education, so we started this project which I will tell you about, but.
I'm not a teacher or working in education.
I work for a foundation, a nonprofit organization, and we give half of our money to social projects and half of our money, which is very, very little.
We each year try to invest in a new project of our own to invest in social innovation in our region of West Flanders in Belgium.
And my machine is just one idea that we started with and that exploded a little bit.
So which I want to talk to you about.
Before maybe I start the presentation I want.
It's a little bit risky in this kind of setting, but still try something.
I want you to imagine.
That you are like.
Six or seven years old and you're sitting in your classroom on a Friday afternoon.

In that setting.
What would be your dream machine if there's something that you would like to have as a machine that works for you that can do something for you, that can mean something for you.

You don't think you don't know it.
